title: AHA Scientific Statement 2021: Perioperative Neurological Evaluation and Stroke Risk Reduction

recommendations.text: Stratify thromboembolic risk in nonvalvular AF with CHA2DS2-VASc; stratify prosthetic valve risk by valve type/location and patient factors.
Stratify VTE risk by time since diagnosis and patient factors; defer elective operations for at least 3 months after VTE.
Defer elective surgery after PCI: at least 14 days for balloon angioplasty, 30 days for bare-metal stent, and 1 year for drug-eluting stent placement.
Defer elective operations for at least 9 months after ischemic stroke when feasible.
Stratify patient bleeding risk with HAS-BLED and procedure-related bleeding risk with surgical assessment.
No evidence supports antiplatelet bridging or heparin bridging for DOACs; consider warfarin bridging only in high VTE risk patients and stop warfarin about 5 days pre-op.
Avoid significant intraoperative hypotension; consider maintaining MAP above ~70 mm Hg when possible to reduce end-organ injury risk.
Monitor for anemia and consider cerebral perfusion reserve in patients with cerebrovascular disease when selecting transfusion thresholds.
Avoid hypocapnia in high-risk patients; use lung-protective ventilation to reduce perioperative complications and hypoxemia.
Maintain vigilance for in-hospital/perioperative stroke and establish rapid recognition and response pathways.
